Notes: CTOL 5th-gen with AN/APG-81 AESA radar (200+ km detection), sensor fusion, and internal 4-6 AIM-120D missiles for stealthy BVR; DAS/EOTS and MADL/Link-16 enable cooperative kills with E-737 cueing to 160 km envelope; 40 operational across 3 squadrons (e.g., 17th at Cheongju), with 20 more on order toward 60 total by 2028.

4.5-gen heavy fighter with AN/APG-63(V)3 AESA (250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 8-12 AIM-120D pylons for high-volume BVR; KF-2000 upgrades (2025 IOC) add conformal tanks and datalink; No. 11th Fighter Wing at Daegu, core for peninsula defense with 160 km effective range via ground radars.

Block 52 variant with AN/APG-68(V)9 radar (150 km), fly-by-wire, and 6-8 AIM-120D loads for agile BVR; Block 70 upgrades on 40 units (2025) enhance ECCM; 20th Fighter Wing at Seosan, sustains QRA with Link-16 for networked 140 km engagements.
Two-seat variant with identical AN/APG-68(V)9 and 4-6 AIM-120D missiles for tactics/operational BVR; supports ELINT fusion and two-ship ops; integrated with F-35A for hybrid formations.

Type: Advanced Supersonic Trainer / Light Multirole Fighter
Notes: Supersonic advanced trainer with fly-by-wire, EL/M-2032 radar option (150 km), and light armament (4-6 AIM-9/AGM-65 pylons) for lead-in fighter training and secondary CAS/BVR-lite roles; full IOC since 2005, supports conversion to F-35A/KF-16 with datalink integration; No. 20th Fighter Wing at Seosan, enables cost-effective surge training for networked 120 km envelopes via E-737 cueing.

MESA AESA radar (400 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120D updates; vital kill-chain enabler via KFDL/Link-16; 7th Airlift Wing at Gimpo, full IOC 2025 for persistent peninsula coverage.
MRTT with boom/probe refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-35A/F-15K; 17th Tactical Airlift Wing at Cheongju, enables sustained ops in Korean theater with USFK integration.

Lightweight with EL/M-2032 radar (150 km), 4-6 AIM-120C-7 pylons for cost-effective BVR filler; 16th Fighter Wing at Yecheon, supports forward basing and datalink cueing from E-737 for 120 km engagements.
